p.span: Creates a 'User Defined' Context with specified parameters. The fields type, count, min, and max must be passed in as parameters. If the type is 'domain', then the fields avg, median and size will be ignored. If the type is 'average_centered', then the fields count, median, min and max will be ignored. If the type is 'median_centered', then the fields avg, count, min and max will be ignored. See xsCreateDDContext for details about creating a Context using data from a search instead of 'User Defined' data.

xsCreateUDContext name=string terms="string(,string)*" count=int [class="string(,string)*"] [container=string] [endshape=(curve|linear)] [notes=string] [read=string] [save=(true|false)] [scope=(private|app|global)] [search=string] [shape=(pi|trapezoid|triangle|curveincrease|curvedecrease|linearincrease|lineardecrease)] (type=average_centered avg=double size=double | type=average_centered median=double size=double | type=domain min=double max=double) [uom=string] [write=string]
xsCreateUDContext name=ArrDelay terms="early,ontime,late" type=average_centered avg=0 count=10000 size=30 max=100 min=0 uom=minutes
Creates an Average-centered Context, centered at 0, with 3 terms (early, ontime, late) using minutes as the unit of measure (UOM).
| xsCreateUDContext name=AirTime type=domain terms="minimal,short,medium,long,extended" min=60 max=1400 count=1000 avg=0 size=0 uom=minutes
Creates an Domain Context with the min/max and count specified, the unit of measure is minutes.
avg, class, container, count, endshape, max, median, min, name, notes, read, scope, search, shape, size, terms, type, uom, writem
The average value of the field.
A comma separated list of classes.
The container to store the context.
The shape of the end concepts. This defaults to curve.
The maximum value of the field.
The median value of the field.
The minimum value of the field.
A legal string which specifies the name by which the created Context will be known.
A description of the context. This defaults to 'none'.
Read permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).
Save the context after it is created. The default value is "true". To turn off save, set save=false.
Where to save the context (private, app, global). This defaults to global.
The search string used to generate data
The shape of the middle concepts. This defaults to pi.
The size of a concept (before multiplying by width).
A comma delimited set of legal strings which define the names of the terms within the Context.
average_centered' - centers the context on the average and uses std dev to scale term sizes.
domain - the default, centers the set on (max-min)/2 and scales the context to cover the whole domain.
Write permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).

The context created by xsCreateUDContext is displayed in table or chart format. See xsDisplayContext for details about display of the created Context.
See xsCreateDDContext for details about creating a Context using a 'streaming' command instead of a 'generating' command.
